job_title: Computer Science Tutor in Ogden, UT
pros: They are flexible with school schedules.
cons: There are no cons at all!

job_title: Graduate Student in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: great location in a great state
cons: A little bit borning at this school

pros: (Mostly) flexible with class schedule Work on campus
cons: Most of the supervisors micromanage you constantly and do not trust you to do your job. The boss refuses to use a computer to generate schedules, and instead insists on creating schedules by hand. This results in him pushing against your availability and giving you shifts and hours that don't make sense. I was told I was a lead proctor (leads get priority in schedule decisions) and despite being available to open, was given weekends and only closing shifts, and sometimes even 2 hour shifts which are a waste of time.

pros: I would go back, I loved my coworkers and manager
cons: Barely paid over minimum wage.

job_title: Computer Lab Assistant in Ogden, UT
pros: Good job for students, as it allows a flexible schedule
cons: Can be boring sometimes, and pay is small

review_title: Good pay (if you’re a male professor)
pros: Having summers and holidays off
cons: Professor salaries are public. Female professors who have the same qualifications as their make counterparts make less $. Look it up. This university is run by the HR department.

pros: Love working in the admissions office Flexibility, always willing to work with you Kelani is an enrollment specialist there and she is awesome at it
cons: No benefits since you are a part-time Can’t be hectic before semesters start

job_title: Psychology Lab Manager in Ogden, UT
pros: Very flexible schedule Understanding of students Able to work on homework on the clock at times Able to gain personal relationships with professors
cons: Poor communication from supervisor at times Sometimes easy to feel inferior, almost bullied by supervisor.

job_title: Data Security Analyst in Ogden, UT
pros: -Knowledgeable people to work with -Good community of people
cons: -Degrees are prioritized over experience -Below average pay

pros: Flexible schedule, good management, career development

job_title: Part Time Adjunct Instructor in Ogden, UT
pros: The employees that I worked with at Weber State University were kind, helpful, and supportive.
cons: The pay was very low for the position.

pros: Many different tasks--plenty of creativity and change. Never Boring. Lots of autonomy. Helpind students is rewarding. Beautiful place to work. Great supportive culture.
cons: Always more to do than time will permit.

review_title: Not the best, but not the worst

pros: Works well with my school schedule. Fair pay. Great management.

pros: Great students that want to learn

pros:
Fun, dedicated colleagues
Able to express own creativity in addressing problems and workplace needs
Good benefits
Opportunities for self-development and advancement, such as tuition benefits
cons:
Low pay made affording to work there challenging
Some of the diversity/inclusion proponents felt toxic to work with
Lots of red tape to get even minor but necessary change implemented sometimes

job_title: Information Desk Attendant in Ogden, UT
pros: It's nice to have a job on campus that is flexible with your class schedule. You are able to complete homework when no customers are at the desk. It's a great job for a college student. Supervisors are nice!
cons: It can be loud during busy times. There is no parking pass given, tuition help, and it pays only a little above minimum wage. They offer a free textbook rental program, but I didn't hear about it from my own supervisor or people above her until I graduated.

job_title: Classroom Support Technician in Ogden, UT
pros: Great community and support. Flexible hours and plenty to do.
cons: A handful of teachers are jerks

review_title: Weber State is great, impactful; pay rate not so much
job_title: SBDC Center Director in Ogden, UT
pros: Everyone is trustworthy, wants to do good things for the education system, supportive.
cons: The pay at regional higher ed like this is not great.

pros: the flexible, supervisor is very nice and they are willing to teach you all the things that you don't know.
cons: i don't see any cons at all for this position besides they don't pay that much

pros:
They are great with college student schedules.

Since it grants base, no work-study is needed for this job. 

Hours are very flexible.

Inconsit work.

job_title: Administrative Assistant III in Ogden, UT
pros: WSU offers the best benefits I have ever seen. The people are wonderful to work with and I have loved every minute of the 13+ years I have worked here.
cons: WSU does not pay their employees well. They make up for it with awesome benefits that may not always work for you.

job_title: Information Technology Specialist in Ogden, UT

cons: Staff salaries are nowhere near industry standard and pay increases are generally line up with cost of living increases of 1 - 3% per year.

-Get ability to get free CEUS.

review_title: Practical experience in an administrative setting; work-study is a great experience!
pros: Working in the Student Services building was far more engaging that if I had remained an 'average' student who simply comes to class. You get to know people in different offices and learn the layout of the land. For those seeking additional experience (or their first job to put on a resume), work-study in ANY Student Services office is a great way to go.
cons: It can be difficult learning to balance course work with work work, even though it's part-time. The issue is that there's so many other work-study employees trying to keep an office operational that things get bogged down, shifts sometimes go uncovered because they're swapped one too many times.

review_title: WSU is a great place to work.
pros: Very flexible hours for part time workers. Understanding of student needs, and will help you prioritize your time well between school and work. I love my co workers. Everyone genuinely is interested and caring about your life. It pushes you to work hard for your team. Morale is high, and people are very patient to train you and are receptive to new ideas. Management is always looking out for your best interest.
cons: It is a temporary part time job only,I just wish there were more summer positions or more hours available.

review_title: Shepherd Union Building Manager, supervised building after hours 4-12 am. Helped custodial crews when not busy
pros:
Lots of down time to study
Great boss that listens to problems 
Great coworkers
Fairly flexible schedule, work was tailored around school schedule
cons:
Pretty inefficient use of time and resources
People you serve can be annoying and difficult
Sometimes patron expectations were unrealistic- scheduling would tell them something completely contrary to what could be done. Put us in a position where we had to enforce rules that were common sense.

review_title: WSU is a really good school and a good place to work for.
pros: Good school and good place to work for.
cons: Some supervisors like to act like they are solving rocket science. Easy on some stuff, believe me you will be more successful in your field and that will make your employees want to work with you everyday.

pros:
-Faculty and staff care deeply about the university & the students
-Stunning location with lots of outdoor/recreation opportunities
cons:
-Faculty (at least in my college) are ridiculously overworked. The teaching load is extreme, plus research and service expectations, no TAs; I work 70+ hours/week, and that's normal
-Inadequate administrative support, no TAs, this makes it impossible for faculty to have time to be adequately responsive to student needs
-Under-serviced and at times dangerous facilities

pros: Government work virtually impossible to get fired.
cons: Low pay, hard to work your way up without being someones friend or having ridiculous educational requirements.

pros: Initially, they are very excited to see what you can bring to the table, support you, and encourage you. My boss was extremely relaxed and offered a lot of guided autonomy, but very open to insight and suggestion.
cons: What is expected is far less than should be.  They want you to work but could care less if you work hard or don't work hard.  If you're not LDS expect additional challenges, barriers, opposition and informal discrimination.  Most importantly they will take your advice/work, thank you for it, and do nothing with it.

review_title: Great benefits. Great environment. Great mission.
pros: Excellent small town feel. Great benefits. Great environment. Great mission. Overall love working here.
cons: You can run into some outdated ideals and personalities, even though they are not malicious, that culture is still there. The pay isn't super competitive but the benefits and perks help bridge that gap.

pros: Benefits are pretty great. You accrue sick and vacation time pretty quickly. Using the gym for free is a great bonus. There are many wonderful people at the university and it is a great environment. Many factors really vary depending on what department you are in.
cons: Base salary is fairly miserable. There is occasionally back-biting and some in-fighting between departments. Things can be pretty political within the hierarchy, which can be frustrating and annoying.

pros: I had an excellent team at Weber State. I worked there for four years and had plenty of time to get my work done and do some homework as well.
cons: Being a student worker, you do not get any health benefits and they are very restrictive on how many hours a week you can work, which is hard.

review_title: Not all of WSU is bad, but one department was
pros: Great to work if you are going to school at WSU
cons: Management doesn't care about employees

job_title: Assistant Professr, Management in Ogden, UT
pros: Collegiate culture in the Business School. Mainly non traditional students, most of whom are committed to their learning.  The university provides many professional learning opportunities and is well engaged with the community.
cons: Business School building is old and doesn't reflect the excellent activity which occurs within.

pros:
Discount on student fees for employee and family. 
Beautiful campus and it is always growing.
Constant improvements of office machines, programs and software.
cons:
The lack of conformity on instructions for tasks is huge, so you have to work to find how to complete your tasks.
University is still heavy with constant reminders of LDS world and culture. 
Colleges do not work with each other. Each college is its own separate island.
Separation of staff and faculty is and adjustment.

job_title: Student Technology Assistant in Ogden, UT
pros:
This job is extremely flexible with school schedules and allows you to work on homework during the down time.
As someone who is faculty with a university, you get to work with some of the most expensive software from top companies like Microsoft through their MSDNAA program.
There is also great opportunity to hone system administration skills.
cons: Just like most customer service jobs, it is possible to have to work with troublesome customers.

pros: Studying at work is allowed which makes being a full-time student and working nearly 30hrs a week possible. Laid back atmosphere.
cons: Sometimes there are very difficult students that you have to work with and the pay isn't fantastic either

job_title: Test Proctor in South Ogden, UT
pros: As a student this job was awesome because it allowed me to study at work. This greatly helped me stay on top of my school work and be able to support myself through school.
cons: You are only allowed to work 29hrs/week which can make it difficult to make as much money as you might want. Also the testing centers are closed during most school brakes so that means no work.

review_title: The work is OK and the time off nice, but it's hard to come to terms with never getting raises or bonuses.
pros: Time off and sick leave.  Benefits and tuition discounts.
cons: Pay is low.  Raises are rare to non-existent.  No bonuses.  More students doesn't mean higher pay.

review_title: Great place to learn and work while attending
pros: I worked in the bookstore and really enjoyed my time there. It's a great work environment and the staff around are very willing to work with your school schedule and give you some opportunities to grow.
cons: Low pay, almost no chance for advancement unless you invest a lot of years working there.

review_title: Weber May Be A Good University, But There Are Bad People Running Things
pros: Only a 20 hour/ per week job, 4 hours a day-5 days a week. I had a 5-9 shift so I was done with work before my morning began.
cons: low pay, high stress, high demand, no appreciation, bad supervisors. With the supervisor I had, if you didn't want to be a part of the "religious clique" then you weren't welcomed, and sometimes belittled.

review_title: Great place to work except for salaries
pros: Great work environment and great benefits.
cons: Low salaries and very hard to get raises.

review_title: Great place to work as a student.
job_title: Computer Lab Aide in Ogden, UT
pros: Combine studies and work to increase success in both areas. Studies show that students working on campus perform better in their classes. Working in the computer lab is especially convenient, as there is enough down-time to get other things done, like homework.
cons:
Low Pay
Difficult to get more than 20 hours/week
Doesn't appear as "serious" on a resume

pros: It is close to campus and in the action of it all. There are usually flexible hours. Sometimes can study as you wait.
cons: There is never enough parking and with construction there will be less than usual for the next year until the new science building is completed.

pros:
They treat their employees very well, 
super flexible on hours, 
awesome management,
feels like you actually have a voice in the company
cons:
Capped at 29 hours if you're hourly,
the culture is great if you're LDS and proud of it
Dress code in some departments, but not others, very inconsistent in my opinion

review_title: Happy with my job, don't get paid enough
pros: The benefits are what keeps me at Weber State. 14% goes to my 401(K) without me having to put in for anything, and the flexibility I have for my family is worth not getting paid as much.
cons: Pay is not comprable to other companies with my same position.

pros: The best reason to work for WSU... experience doing many different things.
cons: One downside of working for WSU... Pay is less than the market rate, so the others you work with are... well let us just say you get what you pay for.

pros: I worked at WSU for more than 6 years. The people are fantastic and management really cares about their employees. The institution itself is a wonderful place to work and seek an education. The health insurance and 401K are great benefits.
cons: The pay is not at all competitive.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Ogden, UT
pros: Collaborative, supportive work environment, good life-work balance, excellent benefits
cons: Pay is lower than in the private sector, but the health benefits, free gym access, and 14% employer retirement contribution help to balance this out.

review_title: Rewarding work. Lower pay. Quality and attitude of co-workers varies by department.
pros: Generally rewarding helping students. Overall a very friendly place. Beautiful campus. Great atmosphere. Wellness time each week. Very good opportunity for work/life balance.
cons: Lower pay. Benefits keep being cut back. Some offices/departments have employees with poor attitudes.

review_title: Solid Place to Grow, Tough to Make a Lot
pros:
- Great work environment with plenty of folks loyal to the institution
- Tuition benefit and low cost make advancing your education easy
cons: -Pay is often below industry averages across the board,  leading to a fair bit of turnover or poaching of talent

pros: This is a great place to get real world experience when it comes to technology and sales.
cons: The pay is awful but then again you do have a lot of flexibility

pros: very friendly people. nice mountains. well paid and the living expenses is not high. also you can learn knowledges
cons: not diverse enough, opportunities for international workers are limited because little chance to get sponsored unless you became a professor.

review_title: great place to start as a student
pros: very versatile, very friendly staff and good place to start
cons: pay is low, no benefit for student and dont get enough working hours, limited to 20 per week

pros:
Weber has a nice and collaborative environment. We are given the tools and enough time to get our jobs done with high quality. 
Also it offers great benefits.
cons: Salary it's very low if compared with the same position in other companies.

pros: My supervisors were all willing to listen to my ideas and suggestions.  I was always being encouraged to continue with my education to further my career.
cons: I was a tutor and therefore I would often work with frustrated and often unpleasant students.

job_title: Student Intern University Communications in Ogden, UT
pros: The mentors put in place during the internship are real life professionals so not only safe you learning in your desired field you learn from the best
cons: There was no downside to my experience

pros: flexible, great supervisors, keep our math skills fresh, very satisfying, easy going management, great feedback, works with your school schedule
cons: pay isn't great, very busy tutoring leading up to finals weeks, low availability of hours to work, no summer employment

pros: Great for working around your schedule, good pay with easy opportunities for raises, growth in your own skill-set, helping others.
cons: Fluctuating pay (students don't show up, busy during fall and spring but slow in the summer), difficult students to teach.

pros: Flexible hours, access to campus services
cons: Poor pay, limited hours, limited career growth, leadership

pros: Lots of paid time off. If there is a holiday, almost guaranteed to have it off. Great environment super friendly.
cons: No competitive wages. Could work at another place and make a lot more money.

review_title: If you love education you'll love working at WSU
pros: Benefit package, working close to home and ability to take classes for free.
cons: State funded so you won't get rich working here.

pros: Friendly staff and Flexible
cons: Snow detail, Cheep upright Vacuums

pros: The department really works with your school schedule and it makes it so convenient to go between work and class easily.
cons: Pay could be better, but you can't expect much out of a student job at a University.

pros: This job was the best job. It was like a family and I learned so much about social justice activism here.
cons: None absolutely, none. This job was the best I've ever had at the University.

pros: Everyone got a long great, and the atmosphere was one where everyone could enjoy each others company

pros: Great colleagues, excellent working environment and Business School students are hardworking, intelligent and committed.
cons: Could improve catering options. Would like to see more healthy eating especially Asian food.

pros: Lots of free time to do homework, mostly laid back environment.

review_title: Great job for college students with plenty of time to do homework.

review_title: Great place to work, if you can handle it.

pros: Allows students to work while attending school

pros: Great people,  good benefits,  tuition
